result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad J Scheuerell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Chad J Scheuerell in court. 

Matter is dismissed and read into Case:  15CM2314
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Chad J Scheuerell in court.  

Defendant referred to the Public Defender's Office.  Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Chad J Scheuerell in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin. Attorney appears as friend of the court. David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
